revised_title: Gyro-magnetic Ratio Measurements on Magnetite and Cobalt
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the gyro-magnetic ratio for magnetite and cobalt. They developed a method to create uniform specimens of these materials and used them in a setup to measure the gyro-magnetic resonance amplitude. The results showed that the gyro-magnetic ratio for magnetite was close to the theoretical value, while for cobalt, it was lower. The authors discussed the experimental difficulties and improvements made to achieve accurate measurements.
